intro: Aeridostachya, commonly known as the golden spike grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and panicles of small, golden-yellow florets. The plant is native to various regions in Africa and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Aeridostachya species typically thrive in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
